anoint verb [T]
(IN A CEREMONY)
to make someone holy in a religious ceremony by putting holy water or oil on them
to make someone king or queen, especially as part of a religious ceremony: [ + obj + noun ] In 751 Pepin was anointed king.

(FOR A JOB)
formal to choose someone to do a particular job, usually by a person in authority: [ + as + noun ] It remains to be seen whom the chairman will anoint as his successor.
